questionsData.title: A very acidic soil helps plants grow well.
Telescopes are used to study blood cells.
Fish is covered in fur.
Kinetic theory states that matter is made up of waves.
Convex lens makes objects look larger.
Loudness is measured on dB.
The earth moves and shakes during earthquakes.
Wolfs and jackals belong to the cat-family.
On the pH scale, a value of 1.5 shows high acidity.
questionsData.explain_answer: Yes , The pH scale The strength of an acid or alkali is measured on the pH scale. This measures the concentration of hydrogen ions on a scale of 0 to 14. Low numbers show high acidity. On this scale and 1.5 falls well within that range

questionsData.title: Igloo is a house of hard rock.
When gas leaks from a bottle, the particles get closer.
Microscopes are made of concave lenses.
Blood circulation system was discovered by Louis Pasuer.
An eagle's beak is on its wings.
Rough surfaces reflect less light than soft ones.
When streams come together , they become a river.
Handicapped means disabled people.
AIDS came from African monkeys.
Richter is a measurement unit of earthquakes.
An applicant is someone who applies for a new job.
Alpacas live mainly in……
questionsData.article: Alpacas, south American mammals, are in same family as camels, llamas,vicunas and guanacos. However,alpacas and llamas  are closely related and they can successfully crossbreed. Alpacas are distinguished from llamas by their smaller size . The aplaca also differs from the llama in having a rounded body and in its shaggy fiber coat,  which differs from  camal's  hair and llama's wool covering. An adult alpaca stands approximately 90 cm (35 inches ) high and weighs 65 kg ( 121 pounds ). The fiber of the alpaca is used for making a wide variety of textiles. Alpacas are expert spitters, when they feel threatened, they spit slimy saliva, which is the acidic stomach contains, and project it onto the chosentarget.

questionsData.title: The passenger decided to drawn…..
Look! He's …. his clothes.
She always ….. up at 7 : 00 o'clock.
questionsData.explain_answer:
The correct is "She always gets up at 7 : 00 o'clock."

In this sentence, the verb "get" is used in the present simple tense. When the subject is a third-person singular pronoun (such as "she"), the verb form typically takes an "-s" suffix in the present simple tense. Therefore, "gets " is the correct form in this case.

questionsData.title: He always comes to school early …. he lives beside it.
Sana'a isn't as …. as Hodaidah.
He is like me in many ways .The underlined word is a/an......
questionsData.explain_answer:
the underlined word "like" is an adjective.

Here's why:

  • Verb: A verb describes an action, state of being, or occurrence. "Like" can be a verb meaning "to enjoy" or "to be fond of," but in this sentence, it doesn't describe an action. It describes a similarity between the two people.
  • Noun: A noun names a person, place, thing, or idea. "Like" doesn't fit into any of these categories.
  • Adverb: An adverb modifies a verb, adjective, or another adverb. "Like" modifies the pronoun "me" by describing how he is similar.
  • Adjective: An adjective describes a noun or pronoun. In this sentence, "like" describes the pronoun "me" by indicating similarity.

questionsData.title: Her father died ….. she was 5 years old.
Books are ….. of paper.
questionsData.explain_answer:
"Books are made of paper" 

because:

  • "made" is the past participle form of the verb "make."
  • The sentence structure requires a passive voice, indicating that something is done to the subject (books) by something else (paper).

 we often use the past participle form of the verb to indicate how something is created or what it consists of.
 

نستخدم الكلمة "made" في الجملة  لأنها التصريف الثالث للفعل "make" في الماضي. عندما نتحدث عن المادة أو التركيبة الخاصة بشيء ما، غالبًا ما نستخدم التصريف الثالث للفعل للإشارة إلى كيفية إنشاء الشيء أو مكوناته.

في هذا السياق، يُستخدم "made" للتعبير عن أن الكتب مصنوعة من الورق، مشيرًا إلى أن الورق هو المادة التي تُنشأ منها الكتب.

questionsData.title: I like apples . The underlined word is a/ an....
questionsData.explain_answer:
In the sentence "I like apples," the word "like" is a verb.

Here's why:

  • Verb: A verb describes an action, state of being, or occurrence. In this sentence, "like" describes your feelings of enjoyment towards apples.
  • Noun: A noun names a person, place, thing, or idea. "Like" doesn't fit into any of these categories.
  • Adverb: An adverb modifies a verb, adjective, or another adverb. "Like" doesn't modify anything in this sentence.
  • Adjective: An adjective describes a noun or pronoun. "Like" doesn't describe anything in this sentence.

questionsData.title: I wish I ….. help you.
Noor speaks Arabic…..
I saw some children …. in the garden.
The president is to ….. Egypt this week.
To be a good secretary, you must be good …… using computer.
While his mother ….. lunch , Ahmed did his homework.
questionsData.explain_answer:
The sentence "While his mother was cooking lunch, Ahmed did his homework" contains a combination of tenses:

  1. "His mother was cooking lunch" is in the past continuous tense. It indicates an ongoing action of his mother cooking lunch in the past.

  2. "Ahmed did his homework" is in the past simple tense. It indicates a completed action of Ahmed doing his homework in the past.

You use while + past continuous tense. with the past simple when you want to
show that two actions happen at the same time.

questionsData.title: The suffix ……. changes the word "happy " into an adverb.
The main source of energy is ….. sun.
Which one of these is ( NOT ) a compound?
Zero has ….. form Arabic language.
Have pupils ….. the class.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Use of have/get + infinitive

You use these verbs to replace other instruction words such as ask, tell or order.

Example:

Ask the boy to put away his bag.
→    Have the boy put away his bag.
→    Get the boy to put away his bag.
Note: With have, the infinitive is without to.
